questions.question: What is your happiest memory?
questions.answer: When i got to go to the store with Grandpa and he bought my Ariel doll.

questions.question: Why do you like being a kid?
questions.answer: You're still in school, and you don't do all those adultish things like pay bills and have an account in the bank.

questions.question: One word to describe you would be _______.
questions.answer: Humble.

questions.question: What advice would you give your parents?
questions.answer: I would tell Daddy to work at the house like mommy does.

questions.question: If you could be any animal, which one would you be and why?
questions.answer: I'd be a black pony because I think black looks like a good color on a horse, and I also think baby ponies are cute.

questions.question: What do you like to do for fun?
questions.answer: Let's see... school work... my big book... watching TV... creating Mr. Quacker.

questions.question: Tell about a funny time in your life.
questions.answer: When I was reading quotes from the kids.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do? Why?
questions.answer: Creating Mr. Quacker.  Because Mr. Quacker is a cute ducky, and it was my first ducky.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do with your friends?
questions.answer: Playing Barbies probably.

questions.question: What do you love most about your siblings?
questions.answer: Harmony and Charity: playful. Tony: awesome.

questions.question: What was the nicest thing you did for someone?
questions.answer: I'm guessing it would be like helping Grandpa with the babies.

questions.question: What do you think you will be doing 10 years from now?
questions.answer: Doing a whole whole bunch of musicals and going to college.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do in the summer?
questions.answer: Go swimming!

questions.question: What would be the ideal allowance? Tell me how you would use it.
questions.answer: I would have $40/week... actually, I'd get $100/week!  And I would go to the Disney Store, and buy the dazzling, dazzling Rapunzel doll that was $100.  I'd waste all my money on that!  Actually, I would because she's beautiful.

questions.question: What do you think makes a person good-looking?
questions.answer: A kind heart.

questions.question: Name two things we should do as a family on the weekend.
questions.answer: Go to Lego Land, and go to Science City.

questions.question: What is the grossest thing you can think of?
questions.answer: That would be Zombie Cafe (iPad game), when they serve a lump of green stuff and grossness.

questions.question: What would you do with $1000?
questions.answer: If I had $1000, I would first tithe, then I would spend $100 of it on a really, really expensive Barbie.  And I would spend another part of it at a garage sale, then I would donate some of it, then I would tithe again... I think.... I wouldn't donate it.... I would take the donate half, and I would give it to my mother and father!  All done.

questions.question: What do you want to be when you grow up?
questions.answer: I want to be a designer because I like how you make clothes and fabrics and stuff.

questions.question: How do you think peanut butter is made?
questions.answer: With peanuts, and I know it’s not made with butter.  They smash the peanuts, take out the acid, and put the acid in the peanut butter jar.

questions.question: How tall is Daddy?
questions.answer: Umm… 20 feet tall?

questions.question: How tall is Mommy?
questions.answer: Oh I know I know!  10 feet tall.

questions.question: What does Daddy do at work?
questions.answer: I know what you do at work!  You work on Rhythm City and ask people to buy the DVD.

questions.question: How do you think shows get onto the TV?
questions.answer: on Netflix and the internet.  I think shows get on Netflix I think it’s because… I’m just saying all the wrong words… I bet it’s because people let them use their shows on Netflix, and Netflix would pay them to let them use their shows.

questions.question: Why do you think God put you in our family?
questions.answer: Because I fit in well, and I’m really good with little kids

questions.question: Why do you think the sky is blue?
questions.answer: I think the sky is blue because it goes well with the grass.  Blue and green go good together.

questions.question: If you could spend your time doing only one activity, what would that activity be? Why?
questions.answer: Mmm...it would be….that's a hard one...I would go across the world singing because I think it would be fun singing for a lot of people. And I like singing.

questions.question: If you could learn how to do something new next week, what would you choose? Why?
questions.answer: I would choose learning how to play the guitar because I've always wanted to learn and I think it would be fun to sing along while I played.

questions.question: If you could do something to cheer up a group of kids less fortunate than you, what would you do? Why?
questions.answer: Anything? I would get them a big dinner and give them the leftovers to take home.

questions.question: If you could pick something in your bedroom that would last forever, what would you choose? Why?
questions.answer: My baptismal plaque because it would always remind me that I  made a commitment to Jesus and that He's my savior.

questions.question: If you could send an e-mail or text message to anyone in the world knowing that they would in fact open it and read it, to whom would you send it? What would you say? Why?
questions.answer: Well, I would send it to...ok, so, if they could read it, I would send it to Harmony and Charity and I would say "Harmony and Charity, you are amazeballs sisters and I'm glad you're in my family." And I would put bubbles and hearts and butterflies all over it.

questions.question: If you could have a super power, what would you choose to have? Why? What super-hero name would you choose?
questions.answer: I would probably choose teleportation and teleport to different places in time; because if I had teleportation, I would be able to tell what happened with Adam and Eve, and ride with Noah's ark, and see all the big scary giants in the Promised Land.  And I'd go 100 years in the future to see what the technology is like; my name would be...when I play with Adam, it's always Emma….but I'd choose The Incredible Girl...unless it's already taken.

questions.question: If you could have any animal in the world and shrink it down to a mouse-sized pet, what animal would you choose? Why? What name would you give it? Why?
questions.answer: I would choose a tiger because if I shrunk a tiger it wouldn't hurt if it bit me.  And I'd be able to keep it in a small, enclosed space and be able to play with it.  I would name it Batman because it has black stripes.

questions.question: Where do you think would be the most exciting place in the United States to live? To visit? How about in the world?
questions.answer: Live: Beverly Hills, CA.  Or Disneyworld.  Visit: Hollywood.  World: Either Paris or Italy

questions.question: Can you think of three things we could do to make meals together more interesting and fun for everyone in the family?
questions.answer: We could ... umm... not sure.

questions.question: What is the silliest thing you've ever done? What would you like to do to top it? Why?
questions.answer: I came up with the word, "MERF!"; To top it, I would paint my face like a clown and then go around giving everyone hugs.

questions.question: What is your favorite sport or game? If you could change one rule, what would you change? Why?
questions.answer: Cheerleading; ...I can't change cheerleading rules! How about chess? I'd make it so that every time Tony and I played other people, our queens could move any way she wanted.

questions.question: If you could design the perfect play space for yourself, what would it have in it? Where would it be?
questions.answer: In my space, I would have a piano and a guitar and music books.  I'd also have a karaoke system, an ipad mini, and an iPod 4.  I'd have big blow up balloons of my siblings.  I'd also have a big disco ball that you could turn on and off with a light switch. And there would be special light switches marked yellow, orange, red, green, and purple to make the room change colors.

questions.question: What is the strangest sound you can make? What do you think it sounds the most like in nature?
questions.answer: *makes high pitched noise* *makes weird clicking noise* I think it sounds most like a dolphin. I was going to say cicada, but it doesn't sound like that.

questions.question: What part about being a kid do you think you will miss the most when you grow up? Why? What do you think I/we (the adults) miss the most? Why did you choose that?
questions.answer: That I didn't have to pay bills and my parents took care of me. Because I don't want to use money to pay bill.  I want to buy leisurely items.  I'd way rather spend it on an expensive bedspread.  And not everyone will be as splendid as my parents. You and Daddy miss not having to pay bills, but I know you and Daddy like your jobs. I think if you got the opportunity, you'd go on a missions trip to teach kids piano for free.

questions.question: What is your favorite word right now? What do you like about it? When have you used it recently?
questions.answer: MERF!? Because merf is an awesome word.  And it's my word.  And Maggie's word.  Case closed.

questions.question: If you could swap places with anyone in the world for just a day, who would you choose? Why?
questions.answer: An unmarried princess.  I don't really know of any that are unmarried, cause I only know of one princess.  I want to see how princesses live and see if their lives are as hard as everyone says they are.

questions.question: What do you think would be the best thing about being a dog or cat? Why? What would be the worst thing? Why?
questions.answer: The best thing about being a dog would be sprinting for a long time without gettting tired and I'd get played with a lot.  The worst would be having black and white eyesight and having to eat disgusting dog food.  The worst part of being a cat would be barfing hairballs a lot.

questions.question: If you could double the time you spend on just one subject in school, what would you choose? Why? What subject would you give up in order to do that? Why?
questions.answer: Reading, because I really like reading.  It feeds my brain information I didn't know before. I'd would probably give up science or social studies.

questions.question: What is the most awesome thing you've ever seen? What made it so awesome?
questions.answer: Seeing someone stand on a pole while doing tricks with a soccer ball. It was amazing that he was able to stand on one foot and balance while he was moving the ball around his leg and dribbling it on top of his head.  It was amazing.

questions.question: What is one thing that you think you will definitely be great at when you are an adult? Why?
questions.answer: READING! Because I'm already great at it and it would be kind of hard to learn how to read really, really well and then forget how to read.

questions.question: What is your happiest memory?
questions.answer: The first time I met Noah (church friend).

questions.question: Why do you like being a kid?
questions.answer: Because you have toys, and you can play video games, and candy.

questions.question: One word to describe you would be _______.
questions.answer: That I was born.

questions.question: What advice would you give your parents?
questions.answer: Give us lunch.

questions.question: If you could be any animal, which one would you be and why?
questions.answer: T-Rex, and it's because they're cool, and they're strong, and they're tall.

questions.question: What do you like to do for fun?
questions.answer: Play with my friends.

questions.question: Tell about a funny time in your life.
questions.answer: A book that Angel and me read at night – Nursery rhymes.  We read it in different languages, so it's more funny.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do? Why?
questions.answer: Play on the iPad, because it has a whole bunch of games that I like.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do with your friends?
questions.answer: Play Star Wars and Batman Avengers and stuff.

questions.answer: Angel plays with me a lot.  Charity walks up to me a lot.  And Harmony? ... That sometimes Harmony plays with me.

questions.answer: I played with my friends when they asked me.

questions.question: What do you think you will be doing 10 years from now?
questions.answer: I would be in High School, and I will do homework and I'm gonna have to have lunch money.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do in the summer?
questions.answer: Um... go at the pool.

questions.question: What would be the ideal allowance? Tell me how you would use it.
questions.answer: I would say $30, and I would buy that toy spider web gun.

questions.question: What do you think makes a person good-looking?
questions.answer: When their hair looks nice; when they have nice clothes on.

questions.answer: We could go to a special place to eat, and we could go to Lego Land together.

questions.question: What is the grossest thing you can think of?
questions.answer: Looking at dirty dishes.

questions.question: What would you do with $1000?
questions.answer: I would buy food, video games, and toys, and a house... like a skyscraper if I could.

questions.question: What do you want to be when you grow up?
questions.answer: A police officer, because they get a lot of money, and they save people, and they take villains to jail, and they have a light car... ya know, those lights... and they have a little thing that tells how fast cars are going, and they have computers.

questions.answer: Umm… 10 feet tall? … Oh I’m guessing daddy’s 12 feet tall

questions.answer: You work on the internet.

questions.answer: Because Jesus is creative and he wanted to paint the sky blue.

questions.question: If you could spend your time doing only one activity, what would that activity be? Why?
questions.answer: Playing video games because it entertains me.

questions.answer: Kinda would want to learn a sport... "What sport?" Oh...whatever sport.

questions.question: If you could pick something in your bedroom that would last forever, what would you choose? Why?
questions.answer: Legos.  No reason.

questions.question: If you could send an e-mail or text message to anyone in the world knowing that they would in fact open it and read it, to whom would you send it? What would you say? Why?
questions.answer: To my Dad.  It would say: "Dad, I love you."  Why? Because I love you.

questions.question: If you could have a super power, what would you choose to have? Why? What super-hero name would you choose?
questions.answer: Invincibility. Because I couldn't get hurt and I would never die. I would be named Invincible Man.

questions.question: If you could have any animal in the world and shrink it down to a mouse-sized pet, what animal would you choose? Why? What name would you give it? Why?
questions.answer: I would choose a dinosaur, because if it was small it would be easy to take out its teeth.

questions.question: Where do you think would be the most exciting place in the United States to live? To visit? How about in the world?
questions.answer: Canada.  Because it has Disneyworld there.  Doesn't it have Disneyworld there?  "To visit?"  Florida.  "In the whole world?" Kansas.  Because my friends are here.

questions.question: Can you think of three things we could do to make meals together more interesting and fun for everyone in the family?
questions.answer: Able to let the kids make it theirself but with help if they wanted.

questions.question: What is the silliest thing you've ever done? What would you like to do to top it? Why?
questions.answer: When I was two, I went up to my mom and said a bunch of random stuff in gibberish, and she didn't know what I was saying, and she answered "Really?" and I said "Uh huh!" and I got all happy and stuff.  "Top It?"  I don't know.

questions.question: What is your favorite sport or game? If you could change one rule, what would you change? Why?
questions.answer: Basketball and if it would be a game, it would also be Minecraft.  I wouldn't say Roblox cuz it's a website.  If I could change one rule about basketball, I would say to make the rule that the youngest person named Tony on any team could make the team win whenever he wants.

questions.question: If you could design the perfect play space for yourself, what would it have in it? Where would it be?
questions.answer: It would have Xbox, Playstation 4, Nintendo 64, Wii U, Five controllers with motion plusses built inside, 5 nunchucks, TV, a sofa, and two lamps, and NES, and 4 wavebirds (controllers), and a fan, and a bed.  Oh wait! And a carpet.  Where would it be?  On the right side of my house.

questions.question: What is the grossest thing you can think of?
questions.answer: Really stinky pie

questions.question: Hi little guy!
questions.answer: Waa! Waa! Waaaaaaa!!!

questions.question: What do you think makes a person good-looking?
questions.answer: A ball!
